name: JW Marriott Cannes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel rooms renovated but the lobby looks like a 1980's. Good location but service was horrendous. Attitude at the trot desk and concierge was obnoxious and miserable. No way near what a category 8 or JW should represent. Save your money and go elsewhere.
reviews.title: Don't stay at this hotel

reviews.text: Beautiful location on La Croisette right in the heart of everything. I found the room to be very comfortable and the rooftop pool was great. From the rooftop the view is awesome. The staff at check in and check out were helpful and polite. I was less impressed with the breakfast, it was fine just a rather limited selection for me again it was fine I am a coffee and cereal person. I would return to this location without hesitation.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is well-placed on La Croisette a block from the famous Carlton, A couple blocks from the Film Festival hall and near many great restaurants. The street is always busy with people. Great views of the bay, beach, ships and the street from view rooms. Staff is very helpful and courteous. Breakfast we excellent with a large variety of food from which to choose.
reviews.title: What a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a three night post-cruise stay at the JW Marriott in Cannes; it is important to note that the hotel continues to undergo major constuction and renovation (the Lobby and Restaurant are now being redone) whch greatly impacted our stay in a negative way. We called the hotel directly about 3 weeks prior to our planned arrival date to ask about the status of the construction and were advised that the renovations were complete and that no construction would be going on during our stay. Imagine our surpirse when we arrived and found ourselves in the middle of a hard-hat area - it was most disappointing and we were very annoyed that we were lied to concerning the status of the hotel. That is wrong and unacceptable.
reviews.title: Maybe Things Will Improve When the Renovation is Complete

reviews.text: The hotel's location is very good, the rooms are fine (we were allegedly upgraded to a park view room with balcony due to the condition of the hotel, the honest answer is probably that the construction workers who work 7 days a week and 18 hours per day reside in the standard rooms at the hotel), breakfast is nothing more than average and was served in a room that was only partially complete with different furnitiure every day (honestly, you cant make this stuff up), and the hotel valet parking was a distaster since the entry area into the hotel was blocked by consturction workers and vehicles and we had to stop in the middle of the Boulevard, jump out and hope to find a bellman to give the keys to.......an accident just waiting to happen.
reviews.title: Great staff, average facilities

reviews.text: We stayed at the JW Marriott Cannes July 25-30. I'm a Marriott Gold member. We stayed on points and had a fabulous time! We were upgraded to a garden/partial ocean view with a balcony. The room was a really good size for Europe. The entire staff was excellent and went above and beyond, making dinner recommendations, reservations, calls, etc. Upon check in, a staff member knocked at the door with free bottled water and a small plate of treats. During our stay, they greated us by name, let us know when we received calls from the states, etc. I can't give the staff enough praise! The breakfast in the morning on the terrace was delicious. With stunning views...it was a great way to start the day. The orange juice was beyond delicious. We used the rooftop jacuzzi and lounged on the chairs. The rooftop view of the beach and the Croisette were awesome. The hotel had a magnificent lobby. I'm surprised more people didn't hang out in the lobby to drink and chat. It's definitely a nice gathering space...but was always quiet. The bathroom in our room was wonderful. There was a deep, luxurious tub on one side of the bathroom. It had a device that would let you choose one of three options: use a hand held shower wand, fill the tub with water or use a rain head shower in the back of the tub. On the other side of the bathroom, there's and a traditional shower with a sliding door, also with a rain head. Two showers at once...that made getting ready for dinner a lot faster. :) Great water pressure that made you want to linger. Wonderful robes and slippers. I would definitely return!
reviews.title: Great location and staff - would return!

reviews.text: The worst thing of this hotel is its personnel. Staff do not want to do their job, just staring with mocking smiles on you waiting for a possibility to take some extra wage. During my stay I have a few quarrels because they were not able to take a taxi during hours or clean a trousers appropriately.
reviews.title: The worst hotel in Cannes

reviews.text: The worst thing of this hotel is its personnel. Staff do not want to do their job, just staring with mocking smiles on you waiting for a possibility to take some extra wage. During my stay I have a few quarrels because they were not able to take a taxi during hours or clean a trousers appropriately.
reviews.title: The worst hotel in Cannes

reviews.text: Excellent location. Short staffed at front desk caused several delays when only 1-2 people working. Very nice room and bath with nice amenities on 4th floor. Noisy at times from outside entertainment. Mattress provided very little support and very small pillows so sleeping comfort was disappointing. Breakfast buffet was okay. Pool deck very nice. Stayed here 6 nights with group. All things considered our stay was adequate but not close to the standards of other JWMarriott hotels we've stayed at before in US and Mexico.
reviews.title: Great location, modern facility, a bit under staffed, needs better sleeping comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this property using points, my husband has platinum status at Marriott and we were "upgraded" to a garden view something or another room, the only garden I saw was dead plants on the worn out patio we had. We saw pictures on trip advisor and reviews that made this hotel look so fabulous, but honestly it felt a little like Vegas, and not in a good way. The staff were friendly at check in, but they did not seem genuine, more rehearsed.
reviews.title: What! a let down...

reviews.text: The location is excellent. Couldn't be better.
reviews.title: Great service -hotel needs a bit more improvement
Great location and service
reviews.text: The service was exceptional. The best we had during our entire trip.
The rooms are comfortable however the air-conditioning seems to be working below par. It was always hot and humid in both the public areas and the rooms.
reviews.title: modern-deco style on the croissette

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The magnetic strip cards used for the elevators and for access into rooms do not function 60% of the time. Quite annoying.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I did not get the wireless internet for free, I would have been furious. The internet connection was intermittent and very unreliable.
reviews.title: Okay, But Not A JW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideal destination for a luxury long weekend. Exceptional service and very comfortable hotel. the hotel is ideally situated on the Croisette. We were warmly welcomed by Michael and escorted to a wonderful suite with stunning sea views. The hotel is modern and interiors warm and well executed. The newly opened JW Grill was outstanding, we had dinner and lunch and the restaurant was busy both times we went. Great steaks and fish and save room for the cheesecake.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at JW Marriott Cannes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just spent many months in South East Asia and decided to come to S. Europe for the summer and then I am heading back to Asia. I had a week at the JW Marriott in Cannes.
reviews.title: Hard to give level 4 after staying in Marriott's in Asia But.........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on my criteria of rating hotels (Price for value I received) I wanted to give the Marriott Cannes 3 stars when I compared them to the Courtyard Marriott, Marriott, Renaissance and JW Marriott's I have stayed in over the last 6 months in South East Asia. While at the JW in Cannes I caught an MSNBC special on William Heinecke who is the CEO of the Minor Group that either owns or manages many of the hotels I mentioned above in South East Asia. I only say this as the JW in Cannes could learn a lot from them. I have 7 weeks at different Marriott's coming up in Sept/Oct in Asia so that helps me get over most bumps in the road in travel.
reviews.title: Great experience!

reviews.text: Anyway, my issues. This maybe a small issue to most but enough to bug me a tad. I have been a Platinum member for a few years and Gold and Silver for many prior to that. In Asia every Marriott brand upgraded me to the highest level they had durning my stay (if open and no one paying full price) sometime 4 and 5 levels above the room I booked and was paying for as a reward for staying with Marriott for 75 nights or more a year. I would book a low cost room and was upgraded to Pool Villa Suites in Phuket, and One Bedroom club level suites at all the other brands.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: My mistake was I thought that was kind of a standard. It is NOT. I booked the low end and yes the hotel gave me one level out of at least 6 levels on the upgrade scale. With time to kill after a long great day in Cannes, I went through the booking process on Marriott.com daily to see what rooms were available during my stay and every level was. The option for the hotel to take care of its Platinum guests is there but do not expect it as that is not part of there process. So enough on that. I suggest that Marriott Europe call the Minor Group in Bangkok, Thailand and get some training on long term Marriott customers.
reviews.title: Hotel

description: Nestled between the Mediterranean Sea and the Southern Alps, JW Marriott Cannes boasts an incomparable cultural and artistic heritage. The hotel is located on the former site of the Palais des Festivals, placing it at the heart of a city that steps into the spotlight once a year, when shining stars and international events come together for a film festival that has made Cannes the annual showcase for French elegance. Among its many unique features, JW Marriott Cannes is the only luxury hotel on the Croisette to have its own auditorium seating up to 820 guests. It also offers 16 newly renovated multi-functional and totally flexible conference rooms (including 10 new rooms on the 1st floor).
